lesson_html:
Python provides powerful built-in string methods similar to C# string manipulation methods. These methods allow you to transform, analyze, and modify strings efficiently.

Common String Methods

  • upper(): Converts string to uppercase (similar to C#'s ToUpper())
  • lower(): Converts string to lowercase (similar to C#'s ToLower())
  • strip(): Removes whitespace from start and end (like C#'s Trim())
  • replace(): Replaces substring (equivalent to C#'s Replace())
  • split(): Splits string into list (similar to C#'s Split())

Example Code

text = '  Hello, World!  '
print(text.strip())  # 'Hello, World!'
print(text.upper())  # '  HELLO, WORLD!  '
print(text.replace('World', 'Python'))  # '  Hello, Python!  '

These methods return new strings, as Python strings are immutable (like C# strings).
challenge_py:
def process_name(full_name: str) -> str:
    """Process a full name by:
    1. Removing extra whitespace
    2. Capitalizing first letter of each word
    3. Replacing any 'a' with '@'
    
    Example:
    process_name('  john doe  ') -> 'John Doe@'
    """
    pass
test_py:
from solution import process_name

def test_process_name():
    assert process_name('  john doe  ') == 'John Doe@'
    assert process_name('ALICE smith') == 'Alice Smith@'
    assert process_name('  bob   jones  ') == 'Bob Jones@'
